examples: Let me know when you've had your interview, however it goes.
However we do this, it isn't going to work.

senses.sense: In any way in which.
examples: She offered to help however she could.
Wear your hair however you want.

senses.sense: (proscribed) But, yet, though, although.
examples: *She wanted to go, however she decided against it. (proscribed)

A cannon that combines certain characteristics of field guns and mortars, delivering projectiles with medium velocities, usually with relatively high trajectories; normally a cannon with a tube length of 20 to 30 calibers.
(sports, rugby, ice hockey) A powerfully hit shot.
To attack with a howitzer.

(nautical) A type of two-masted Dutch sailing vessel, weighing between 60 and 200 tons burthen.
(nautical, slang) Obsolete form of hooker ("any antiquated craft").
The protracted, mournful cry of a dog, wolf or other canid; also of other animals.
Any similar sound.
examples: The howl of the wind

senses.sense: A prolonged cry of distress or anguish; a wail.
To utter a loud, protracted, mournful sound or cry, as dogs and wolves often do.
To utter a sound expressive of pain or distress; to cry aloud and mournfully; to lament; to wail.
To make a noise resembling the cry of a wild beast.
examples: They howled with laughter at the prank.

senses.sense: To utter with outcry.
examples: to howl derision

senses.sense: simple past tense and past participle of howl
That which howls, especially an animal such as a wolf or a howler monkey.
(historical) A person hired to howl at a funeral.
(slang) A painfully obvious mistake.
(slang) A hilarious joke.
(slang) A bitterly cold day.
(psychology) A person who expresses aggression openly in the form of threats.
(sometimes figurative) A heavy fall.
(slang) A serious accident (especially to come a howler or go a howler; compare come a cropper).
examples: Our hansom came a howler.

senses.sense: (slang) A tremendous lie; a whopper.
(slang, dated) A fashionably but extravagantly overdressed man, a "howling swell".
(historical) A 32-ounce ceramic, plastic, or stainless steel jug used to transport draft beer.
plural of howler
An owl; an owlet.
plural of howlet
The act of producing howls.
examples: The howling of wolves is haunting at night.

senses.sense: present participle of howl
(colloquial) Used as an intensifier
examples: a howling success

senses.sense: With a howl or howls.
(informal) In a comical way that causes howls of laughter.
examples: his howlingly inappropriate choice of attire

However, in whatever manner.
However, to whatever extent.
Regardless of the way in which.
examples: Howsoever they pleaded, their pleas went unheard.

senses.sense: In any manner whatsoever.
examples: The party to this agreement may use the property whensoever and howsoever he or she pleases.

senses.sense: To whatever degree or extent.
examples: Their evidence, howsoever true it may have been, was not believed.
